thread.title: Pioneer girls enjoy 9-1 soccer rout in Ontario
thread.title_full: Pioneer girls enjoy 9-1 soccer rout in Ontario

title: Pioneer girls enjoy 9-1 soccer rout in Ontario
text: Advertisement ONTARIO, Ore. — McLoughlin evened its Greater Oregon League league record here Saturday in girls soccer action. The Pioneers blasted eight shots at Ontario over the first six minutes, but couldn’t find the back of the net. Once Bianca Garcia broke through in the 10th minute, the Tigers had no answer for the Mac-Hi attack and the Pioneers went on to score eight more times and come away with a 9-1 win. “We played well and had a lot of ball movement,” Pioneer coach Martin Martinez said. “We were quicker than them, got their defense to play way up, and chipped over the defense for scoring opportunities.” Rachael Lyon crossed to Garcia in the 15th minute and the Pioneers were up 2-0. Sydney Richwine, and Adaris Ramirez added Pioneer goals before intermission to give the Pioneers an insurmountable 4-0 lead at the half. “(With the big lead) we wanted to pass the ball more and play more possession (in the second half),” Martinez added. “We made a mistake in our end that led to their goal and it was a little wake up call for us.” Lyon scored on an assist from Mallory Copeland, then it was Leslie Ponce’s turn as the Pioneers stretched the lead to 6-1. Ponce added another, Copeland assisted to Amayrani Alvarez for an 8-1 lead. Garcia connected with Lyon to complete the Pioneer scoring and run the final to 9-1. The Pioneers out shot the Tigers 31-8 in evening their GOL record to 1-1. “We were coming off a loss (La Grande) and a tie (Pendleton),” Martinez said. “We were ready to go.” The Pioneers host La Grande Tuesday at 4 p.m. with a chance to avenge their earlier 2-1 loss. “We know what we need to do,” Martinez said. “We feel confident as our field is longer than theirs and they will have to run more. We have to be mentally ready.” More like this story
